article:
A 'siloxane' is a functional group in organosilicon chemistry with the
Si–O–Si linkage. The parent siloxanes include the oligomeric and
polymeric hydrides with the formulae H(OSiH 2) nOH and
(OSiH 2) n. [http://goldbook.iupac.org/S05671.html
Siloxanes], [[Compendium of Chemical Terminology|IUPAC Gold Book]]
Siloxanes also include branched compounds, the defining feature being that each
pair of silicon centres is separated by one oxygen atom. The siloxane functional
group forms the backbone of silicones, the premier example of which is
polydimethylsiloxane.
